title: REVIEW --- Play: News Quiz
text:
B. Meg Whitman

C. Michael Eisner

D. Jack Welch

---

2. Congress held its first hearing in more than 50 years on the dangers of what?

A. Comic books

B. UFOs

C. Switchblades

D. Cholesterol

---

3. Who just registered the highest Group of Seven inflation since the global price surge began last year?

A. France

B. Italy

C. Canada

D. The U.K.

---

4. Nina Jankowicz resigned as head of a federal initiative aimed at combating what?

A. Irony

B. Disinformation

C. Smoking

D. Tooth decay

---

5. Median home prices hit a new U.S. record in April. What was it?

A. $291,200

B. $391,200

C. $491,200

D. $591,200

---

6. Median CEO pay reached $14.7 million for 2021, yet another S&P 500 record. Who topped the list?

A. Peter Kern of Expedia

B. Tim Cook of Apple

C. Jamie Dimon of J.P. Morgan Chase

D. Hock Tan of Broadcom

---

7. Per a new report, what caused one in six deaths world-wide in 2019?

A. Obesity

B. Nuclear power

C. Pollution

D. Heat

---

8. A lawsuit accuses McDonald's and Wendy's of making their burgers look larger than life in ads -- by what means?

A. Spray-foam insulation

B. Air-filled bladders

C. Soaking them in water

D. Using undercooked patties

---

9. JetBlue launched a hostile takeover bid for Spirit Airlines, which already has a deal to merge -- with whom?

A. Frontier

B. Southwest

C. United

D. People Express

---

ANSWERS

1. D

2. B

3. D

4. B

5. B

6. A

7. C

8. D

9. A
